title: Use the Pomodoro Technique
description: Break your study sessions into 25-minute focused intervals followed by 5-minute breaks. After 4 sessions, take a longer 15-30 minute break.

title: Feynman Technique
description: Explain concepts in simple terms as if teaching someone else. If you struggle, review the material again until you can explain it clearly.

title: Spaced Repetition
description: Review material at increasing intervals over time. Use flashcards and review them after 1 day, 3 days, 7 days, and so on.

title: Mind Mapping
description: Create visual diagrams connecting main concepts to subtopics. Use colors, symbols, and images to make information more memorable.

title: Eliminate Distractions
description: Create a dedicated study space, turn off notifications, use website blockers, and inform others when you're studying.

title: Get Adequate Sleep
description: Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep. Your brain consolidates memories during sleep, making it crucial for learning and retention.

title: Practice Retrieval
description: Test yourself regularly without looking at notes. Active recall strengthens memory pathways more than passive reading.

title: Prioritize with Eisenhower Matrix
description: Categorize tasks by urgency and importance. Focus on important-urgent tasks first, then important-not urgent ones.

title: Stay Hydrated & Eat Well
description: Drink plenty of water and eat brain-healthy foods like nuts, berries, and fish. Avoid heavy meals before studying.

title: Cornell Note-Taking Method
description: Divide your page into three sections: notes, cues, and summary. Review and fill in cues after class, then write a summary.

title: Study in Chunks
description: Break large topics into smaller, manageable chunks. Master one chunk before moving to the next.

title: Teach Others
description: Form study groups and take turns teaching concepts to each other. Teaching is one of the best ways to learn.
